resources.string: FrenchBasqueSurf
SWELL
WIND
TIDES
FORECAST
Image of Swell, Wind or Tide Chart
Forecasted conditions
Name of the beach pictured
Image of beach
Anglet
Grande Plage
Cote de Basque
Milady
Parlementia
St. Jean de Luz
Hendaye
Swell hits Anglet directly, this spot is not for the faint of heart.
Swell gets really hollow here two hours prior to dead low.
Perfect spot for SW swell direction. Long, rolling waves to be had.
Usually less people than Cote De Basque but same wave type.
Outside gets perfect waves, paddle in from the port. Inside gets crowded.
When the swell is too big to surf anywhere else, this place is firing.
Hendaye handles all swell directions and provides soft, longboardable waves.
Winds over 20kph (from any direction) blow out the spot.
Protected from North and South winds. Good on most days.
Winds from the South will blow it out but it is protected from the North.
Exposed from all directions. When the wind is up, this is out.
Too strong of a wind will make you drift out to sea. Keep alert.
Winds have no effect on this spot. It\'s protected from all angles.
Winds over 20kph create a current but it\'s always still surfable.
Anglet works on all tides. Keep an eye out for rocks in certain places though.
An hour before and after both High and Low tides is not the time to be in the water.
An hour or two before and after High tide are the only times to avoid.
Low tide shows all the rocks. But at least you know where not to be.
Outside works at either tide. On the inside; watch out for the reef.
Going into and out of Low tides can be dangerous. Pay attention to the tides here.
All tides work. But you will have to shift south at High tide.
Gentle onshore wind that dies down around noon.
Waves are perfect.Crowds will be out there today!
High tide at 11 a.m. Anytime after 12 noon will be great.
Surf is perfect before 5:15 p.m. which is Dead Low Tide.
Inside and outside will be firing all day.
Might be a small bump but plenty of other spots open.
Waves will be in the waist high range.
